intro: Scorzonera bupleurifolia, commonly known as the meadow scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers. It is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
